FacilityName: Gavilon Ag Service, Inc. Benton NH3

_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: Review and update of safety procedures and policies

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary



Gavilon Environmental Health and Safety Policy

Gavilon will uphold its position as a global leader by promoting EHS excellence and is committed to: 

? Creating a safe and healthy workplace for all employees and customers

? Respecting the environment in the communities in which we live and work

? Continually evaluating and improving our EHS performance across a broad range of EHS initiatives

? Conforming to the letter and spirit of Gavilon's EHS requirements as well as applicable laws and regulations

? Recognizing that proactive EHS initiatives are a value-added contribution to its customers and the local community in which we live and work

? Promoting EHS excellence throughout the organization and assuring EHS is an integral value in evaluating company performance



Gavilon will work to achieve these initiatives by:

? Integrating EHS considerations into business planning, decision-making, and daily activities throughout our global operations

? Providing resources and training to carry out this policy everywhere we do business

? Managing resources in an environmentally conscientious way

? Utilizing our business sectors to develop new and innovative ways to reduce waste

? Soliciting employee involvement in EHS programs

? Requiring that all employees be responsible for their safety, the safety of their co-workers, customers and the environment

? Communicating our EHS policy to employees, local communities and affected parties throughout the world



Through the successful implementation of the EHS policy, Gavilon will maintain its position as a global leader in the management of the world's most essential commodities.



Facility Overview

The Gavilon Grain Benton facility is a retail fertilizer facility.  The facility has one 30,000-gallon anhydrous ammonia storage tank and 1,000 gallon nurse tanks.  Gavilon personnel staff the facility year round during normal business hours.    



General Accidental Release P

revention Program 

To prevent releases, Gavilon Grain Benton facility complies with applicable anhydrous ammonia regulations and standards such as

? ANSI K-61.1-1989 "Safe Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", as adopted by the Iowa Department of Agriculture and Land Stewardship (IDALS).

? The Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) 29 Code of Federal Regulations section 1910.111 "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia"



Gavilon also has the following safety programs related to anhydrous ammonia:

? Maintenance and inspections

? Training

? Operating procedures



Five-Year Accident History

No accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia have occurred at this facility in the past five years.



Emergency Response Program

Due to the  and number of employees, the Gavilon Ag Services Benton facility will not conduct emergency response to an anhydrous ammonia release.  Instead, Gavilon relies on proper prevention measures, the local fire department and the closest hazardous materials responders and contractors.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Gavilon continually strives to improve its safety programs.  At this time, Gavilon has identified the following planned changes for the near future: revision and update to the anhydrous ammonia safety program.
